column4: I need to create WIFI network via /etc/network/interfaces on 10.04. Is there a good guide on this?
why do you have to do it via that particular path?
for reasons ) can you help me?
just need to know what to type in the /etc/network/interfaces - how to setup key, ssid, and make my dhcp to work over it upon its start
actually, I'm having the Internet via WiMax using a device with reverse engineered driver which doesn't like NM for some reasons. So I have to stop NM service every time I run the Internet
and now I just need to share my internet with a comrade laying near me in the hospital ))))
well, if you're connected via wireless, I'm not sure if you can create your own ad-hoc wireless network, but lemme do a little more digging
when you say WiMax, are you talking about 3g?
I don't know technical details but afaik WiMax is what a provider called "Yota" here in Moscow uses in his network and I thikn its more like WiFi, but fires on broader distances )
hm, well, if it's using your wireless card, I don't think you'll be able to make a wireless network with it and keep your connection
oh, it might be possible/easier if you have a wifi USB dongle so you can use one wireless device to connect to the internet and another to broadcast your adhoc network
no, I use a special device, plugged into usb
so they are different devices - one for the Internet, and another - for Wifi
